question:
Consider the following:
  1. Time deposit with banks
  2. Demand deposit with banks
  3. Money with public in the form of cash
  4. Post office deposit
Which of the above are included under Narrow Money?
explanation:
At any point of time, the money held with the public has two most liquid components. While M1/M0 is generally used to describe narrow money, M2/M3/M4 qualifies as broad money. Demand Deposit component is the money of the general public with the banks, which can be withdrawn by them using cheques, withdrawals and ATMs.
M1 = Currency with the public + Demand Deposits of public in Banks
When a third component viz. Post office Savings Deposits is also added to M1, it becomes M2.
M2 = M1 + Post Office Savings.
M3=M2 + Time Deposits
